text: Menes was a pharaoh of the first dynasty of ancient Egypt. He lived ca. 3100-3000 BC. He brought together Upper and Lower Egypt to make an empire. He wore the Pschent or double crown: the white crown of Upper Egypt and the red crown of Lower Egypt. He built the city of Memphis and made it the capital. There is a lot of archeological evidence that there was a pharaoh named Narmer, but little evidence for a pharaoh named Menes.Gardiner, Alan. Egypt of the Pharaohs. p. 405. Oxford University Press, 1961 It is now believed that Menes was either Narmer, the pharaoh before Narmer, or Hor-Aha, who ruled after him. More than 2000 years later Manetho, an Egyptian historian, wrote that Menes ruled for 62 years and was killed by a hippopotamus. An image of Menes holding an ankh is on the frieze on the south wall of the U.S. Supreme Court building."Courtroom Friezes: North and South Walls: Information Sheet." Supreme Court of the United States. == References == * Kinnaer, Jacques. What is Really Known About the Narmer Palette?, KMT: A Modern Journal of Ancient Egypt, Spring 2004. *Toby A. H. Wilkinson, Early Dynastic Egypt, Routledge, London/New York 1999, , 70-71 ==Notes== == Other websites == *Narmer: Titulary Category:4th-millennium BC pharaohs Category:Pharaohs of the First Dynasty of Egypt
title: Menes
